title: How to Make a Paper Hat
original_title: How to Make a Paper Hat
content: how to make a paper hat save money on your child's next party by making your own party hats or have the kids make their own for a fun birthday party activity you will need newspaper a flat work surface an elastic cord a hole punch and hat decorations step 1 fold a sheet of newspaper in half on your work surface the bigger the paper the bigger the Hat experiment to find the right sized paper step 2 arranged the folded paper in front of you so that the fold is at the top and the opening is at the bottom step 3 fold the two top corners to the middle of the paper so that you form a point on top step 4 fold the top sheet at the bottom open end upward and over the flaps you folded down double the fold and then turn the hat over to fold the other side step 5 punch holes in either side of the hat thread an elastic cord through the holes and tie it for the chin strap step 6 customize your hat with streamers crayons or other decorations to make each child's hat unique did you know Napoleon wore his bicorn hat with the two horizontal points parallel to his shoulders to distinguish himself from other officers on the battlefield [Music]

title: How to Make a Paper Hat
original_title: HOW TO MAKE A PAPER HAT
content: hi guys welcome back to origami twist my name is Jenna and today's video is one that is meant for all of those people who have been dealing with snow days and born children as a result of the snow days now as you probably know I live in Australia but I am from the northeastern part of the United States and boy oh boy have you guys had some weather recently whoa Facebook was literally blowing up with oh no not another snow day we're gonna be going to school in July at this rate right oh it's horrible but if you've got young children and they're stuck inside all day hopefully you got up to play in the snow but this particular project is great for imagination and playing dress-up and coming up with stories and ideas and basically kicking the kids out of boredom and you don't have to be in a snow snowy area of the world in order to do it it is the classic newspaper paper hat so yes you probably already have all the materials necessary to make this project and say all you need again one sheet of newspaper and let's get started so I have a what appears to be like a half size newspaper and if you've got one of those big ones just fold it in half and then fold it in half again until you have this rectangle about this size then the rest of it is really really easy you're just gonna fold one corner in to make a right triangle there you go and you're folding at the middle and then you're going to fold the other corner in to make another right triangle again folding down in the middle so you'll have a long skinny strip down here and two triangles up top you're going to fold this flap up it onto itself okay let's see how I folded it up onto itself to meet the bottom of those triangles and then you just fold it up again okay now you're going to turn it around and do the same thing you're gonna fold that bottom flap up so that it meets roughly at this point at the bottom of the triangle and you should be able to tell where that bottom is just by looking at the other side so just guess it's very rough it doesn't have to be perfect and then you're gonna fold that rectangle up again so that it matches the other side now all that you need to do at this stage is open it up and as you can see it creates what appears to be like a captain's hat now I'm sorry I haven't been looking at you this whole time I'm trying to see myself in the screen I'm not used to doing tutorials this way so thank you for bearing with me and without further ado that's it okay now I've got another couple of videos that work great with this it's called the captain's shirt story it uses this as a base and then it turns into a really neat interesting story so if you're interested in going a bit further with this fold let me know in the comments below and I'll make videos for that so in the comments below yes please on the captain's shirt story or whatever you know you'd like to put down there and thank you so much for watching please subscribe if you enjoy paper crafting and that sort of thing and I hope you guys have a fabulous day bye

content: hi I'm Jenny Jones and I'm an arts and crafts expert I'm here today to show you how to make a paper hats you can use any paper to make your paper hat but I would recommend that you use a nice big piece of newspaper or a3 paper if you want your hat to fit your head you're going to need one full sheet of newspaper what you need to do to start with is take the top of the paper and fold it down make a crease and then I want you to take your ruler and you need to measure half way draw a line place your ruler and your pencil to the side and then you're going to take the top left-hand corner of the newspaper and fold it down to that middle center line and make a crease now do the same for the other side to the middle and make a crease okay and then I want you to take the top piece of paper and fold it up again make a crease across and you need to turn the newspaper over now depending how much you fold these size bits in or determine whether it'll fit your head or not so if it's for myself I would fold it in about this much and do the same for the other side and then lastly you need to fold the other side of the paper up to match make a crease and there you have it you'll paper hat this hat would be absolutely perfect for a pirate party or even a sailor party and that's how to make a paper hat you

content: okay hi guys today we're going to make a Mother's Day hat for you and it's for Mother's Day coming up on Sunday we're gonna have a little Mother's Day Tea Party for Jillian's preschool tomorrow so we're doing this in preparation for that for all the moms in her preschool see so it looks really cute on this is the finished product and all the moms I'm happy to wear it tomorrow so here we go so the things that you're going to need is one large piece of butcher paper or newsprint will work too and then you're going to need two sized bowls one larger than the other and so two bowls scissors stapler really just stapler and some tape okay so let's get started so first you start off by forming the Hat so you need a mold and that's what the bowls are going to do I'm going to put the bowl underneath the smaller bowl goes underneath the paper okay right in the center and then Julian can you help switch down the paper a little bit okay there you go so then you're going to place the larger bowl on top put your hand up go ahead and push down the bolt and that's the uniform that the top with the Hat and you kind of just spread off the paper give me a lot of folding and cutting involved with this and stately okay this is just getting the shape of the Hat once that's down secure then you can lift it up there's the top of the half a little Bowl still there okay let's put it back we don't want to lose our shape here so the next thing I'm going to do is to secure the shape we're going to use some masking tape okay so Jillian why don't you hold down this paper you hold the top and we're going to start just circling around the Hat with the tape kind of press it down as you go good job Jill and then we're gonna have to measure it to see if it fits okay it's a little bit big so you can take it in by folding it a little bit so if it's a little big you can just kind of fold it over a little bit what we're going to do the rim in a second okay and then just use some more tape I like to put a second row tape on just to make it really secure since the paper is very large I'm going to trim the edges so we have less paper to work with I'm just going to go around and trim it kind of in a circle okay so now this is the fun part with the kids you'll get to make the brim of the Hat just like this so it has a little brim all around the sides make it finished and look nice so what they're going to do is just fold around and go all the way around okay go ahead Jo keep folding it up go and turning it and kind of go along after them and press it down press it down right there you go and then I'm going to go around behind her and staple it to secure it and it doesn't have to be even lots of muscles then there's your undecorated hat ready to go let's see okay so we're done with the hats the only thing left to do is to paint them and make them colorful so tomorrow we're going to paint them with their preschool class and it should be a lot of fun right okay so see you tomorrow

content: today I'm going to show you how to make a Indian hat out of construction paper with just a few steps first i'm going to show you what materials you need you need a construction paper you need your feathers to need your paint and your paintbrushes a stapler scissors and some clue to get started the first step is to cut the construction paper now you have to make sure and figure out how big your head is so you need to see how how much you're going to need so you can just cut into strips this small strips they don't need to be huge stripped so because my head is a bit larger than this we're going to need two of those strips so there you are you're our two strips we need to put them together the next step to put them two going together you must have your stapler so you're going to staple it on one side now put it around and see how far you need it I'm just going to be here and then you have it together after you put it together you are going to put your feet so you can pay anything you want so what I'm going to do is I'm just going to ask the blue dots just around and then I'm just going to do a green squiggly line so you're going to put your feathers so what you're going to do is you're going to take your glue and you're going to glue it to be back and you can add how many friends you want so I'm just going to add three feathers so there's your and now you have an Indian happy as a warrior I hope that you enjoyed your half and now you can make it in any thanksgiving party or any time you want to make a deviant hat for fun and you can use any kind of construction paper any kind of ribbons you can mix and match you can add a whole lot of art and you can have lots of fun with that

title: How to Make a Paper Hat
original_title: How to Make a Three-Sided Paper Hat : Paper Crafts
content: hi my name is Laura I'm an artist and I'm going to show you how to make a three sided paper hat what you're going to need is a sheet of paper I have an eight-and-a-half by 11 sheet of paper it's going to make a small hat so if you want to make a larger hat use a larger sheet of paper so first the first step is you're gonna fold the paper in half lengthwise like this after you fold it use your fingernail to to make that fold sharper and then what you're going to do is make sure that the folded side is away from you the open edges toward you fold the upper right and left hand corners in toward each other so that they meet in the middle and then do a sort of temporary temporary fold and then again sharpen that with your fingernail on both sides and you'll have flaps left facing towards you what you're going to do is fold one side up on one side fingernail it down and then flip it over and take that other flap up on the other side and then you have one two three corners on your hat and you can put it on your head like that I am Laura thank you for watching how to make a three sided paper hat

title: How to Make a Paper Hat
original_title: Tutorial on How to Make a Flat Brimmed Paper Hat (New Era Style)
content: hey everybody this is gonna be a tutorial on how to make a paper hat so the first step is you want to draw three shapes that look like this now the first shape you draw is gonna have a curve right there and then the second one is gonna be a little bit less curved but a slant going up there but a small slit and then the third is going to be the smallest piece and the less curved on the edge once you have this drawing out what you're gonna do is you're gonna cut each one out after you cut them out you're gonna have three of these and you're gonna take one of them put them on a white piece of paper and trace around because what you're doing is you're you're making two of each shape and so you're making sure that each one is the same size as the one before because if it's not the hats not gonna fit together correctly and once you have all those traced what you're gonna do is take some scissors and you're gonna cut each one out this is the time to color them and if you want to once you have them all cut out what you're gonna do is you're gonna take one of them and you're gonna draw lines like this around the edge these represent the seams of the Hat and if you want to you can also do a dotted line for these instead but you can do it however you want and you're gonna do that for every single one make sure that for these pieces the two largest ones the slant is going down on that side and going up on that one it's almost like a mirror image once you have them all drawn on what you're gonna do is you're gonna take these to make sure it's those two take a piece of tape tape on the back and then you're gonna put together you are now starting to put the Hat together take another piece of tape and put it on the back and put them together you're gonna be doing this for each one just make sure that you don't tape too close to the top because when you're done sometimes it doesn't fit together quite right so you want to make sure you have enough room if you need to adjust now the next two pieces is you want to put ones of the smallest ones on one side and the other smallest piece on the other side each side has to be symmetrical because if you don't put them in to get together in the right order the hats not going to come out right so you have to make sure you're doing it in this order and then take that other small piece and attach it to the other side like that now for the two largest pieces which are the two lost you have to be careful about this make sure that the slants on this are going kind of in the mirror image again going opposite but then after that you just do what you've been doing the whole time taping on the back and then putting together like this just like that just make sure that the slants are going the opposite direction these two last pieces are usually the most difficult to put together because everything is a little bit crowded because it's making the circular shape so it may be a little bit difficult in the video you can tell that I'm gonna have a little bit of trouble with it but it seemed pretty easy to work around but just keep taping to the back and then putting it together like that and if you have a gap at the top that's completely fine or if you have a little bit of tape left over there don't worry about it and if you do have any extra tape up there what you can do is just take some scissors and cut off the extra tape and don't worry about that gap at the top because that's gonna be covered up later now what you're gonna do is you're gonna take some cardboard make sure it's thin cardboard you can use anything you want as you can see here I use some Ritz cardboard so you can do anything you really want make about six tabs like that you you actually really only need four but um I'm just doing that in case I mess out so then take some tape you can bend it too it might make it easier and then put it in like that and just keep taping around the entire hat this is to make the Hat more sturdy and it also gives the Hat the round shape so that if you wear it it won't crumble or anything when you put it on and so just keep taping around the top and bottom make sure they're on there correctly make sure they won't fall off and you may notice you can see through the white hat to the cardboard but that's fine if you have your head actually colored in right now you um you probably can't even see it so it's fine now what you're gonna do is you're gonna make the brim for that so put the Hat down like that and you're gonna make kind of a half circle like this yeah and kind of draw it in lightly in case you mess up so you can erase it and there won't be any left over marks and once you have it right or how you like it just go around and darken it back in like that and then put the hat back on and you're just gonna make a half circle around the edges like this and by now which it look like a half moon and then just darken it in and then once you have it all darken in you're gonna cut it out with some scissors and this is when you can color the Birman if you want to now what we're gonna do is you're gonna take some pencil and you're gonna draw some lines like this these represent the seams of the brim so just draw it around like that you can also do these dotted lines here instead if you want but you can do it any way and just keep doing that but before you get to the very end about this point stop and just leave that area blank in there now you're gonna take some cardboard and you're gonna trace around the paper it's okay if the cardboard is a little bit too small as you can see here I have him used a little bit too small a piece but it's fine just make sure it's not too small and then you're gonna cut it out because this is gonna make the brim more stiff and then you're gonna take some glue glue the cardboard and then you're just gonna put the brim the paper broom onto the cardboard once you're done with that you can flip it over and if you have any writing like here and writing like that what you do is you trace around and then you cut that out and then you're just gonna put it over the words or whatever there is there so you don't see it and then put it down like that and if you can still see through you just do it again and then you won't be able to see it now what you're gonna do is you're gonna make sure that shape is the same shape you see on the Hat it has to be that shape because that's the front tape the brim put a few pieces on and tape it to the bottom of the Hat make sure it's on straight now you're gonna fill that gap in so take some paper cut out a square rectangular shape and you're gonna glue the inside of the Hat like this and then Pat that down inside and then you can't see through anymore like that now what you're gonna do is you're gonna make the airholes for that so take some paper and draw six circles and put dark dots in the middle of each one and then cut them out once you have them all cut out take some glue glue the bottom of them and paste them on in these areas on the Hat now we're gonna make the very top of the Hat so take some paper cut out cut out a strip about this big I actually think I made it a little bit too long take some glue glue the end and make a circle shape about this size and glue both ends together once you have that done take a piece of paper cut out a circle about this big take the other piece glue the bottom put that on top and then once you get that on glue the other side you might want to use a little bit more glue than I did here and then put that on the top right there now this is the point when you can put logos on here here here I used EC and a bunch of them but you can do anything you want and also you can go online print this sticker off glue the back and put it on the brim to give it a more realistic look and there you go there's your hat if you have any questions you can message me and I'll answer anything if you want you can also put your video of your hat as a video response to this I'd love to see it good luck

title: How to Make a Paper Hat
original_title: How to Make a Paper Hat for your Christmas Cracker
content: hello and welcome to tutti frutti my name is Anita and today I'm going to show you how to make a paper hat for your Christmas cracker for this you're going to use some tissue paper a ruler a pencil some glue and some scissors I'm using a twenty by thirty inch piece of paper and I'm going to fold it into four making four hats let's speed this up a bit my head is 24 inches so that's the measurement I'm going to use for my hats my head's quite big so now we're going to measure 24 inches along the paper and then cut just over that so now we're going to fold it into three and then we're going to cut off the top and the bottom so that there we have four separate hats now we're going to cut a triangle in the top followed by half a triangle now we're going to glue the two sides together thank you for watching and if you'd like me to show you how to make the cracker from the Hat then you'll find the link in the description below bye for now

title: How to Make a Paper Hat

content: I'm going to show you how to make this fun bowlers hat for Saint Patrick's Day or any other occasion for which you would need a bowlers hat the first thing you're going to need is your newspaper base that's done with one that has a deep Bowl for the Hat put it out on the table you get it as flat as you can around the edges and once you have that done you're simply going to start rolling the edges up and just gonna roll all the way around because you're kind of preparing this newspaper to be your bowlers hat once you've gone around the first time go ahead and start taping it all the way around you might have to take fairly often but you might not it depends on your newspaper once you've gotten your hat to the point where you taped it all up you can look at it and see if it's in as close as you want and has that bowler hat look to it once you have done that you're going to want to take tempera paint or any other paint I took this tempered paint put it in a big paper plate and use the large brush to paint the whole hat newspaper is very thin paper and it takes a long time to dry so you want to make sure your hat is completely dry before you start decorating it but in the meantime you can cut out what you're going to use to make your decorations I use simply three hearts that I cut out of construction paper and I made them the same size so I use the first one as a template cut the second one and cut the third one and for these I covered them with Elmer's glue and then I sprinkled green glitter on them and let it dry and once that was done I put them together three hearts with a little dab of glue I'll put a little piece of tape that'll give you the idea and my shamrock was ready to go from my bowlers hat then once my hat was dry I started making that other decorations for it no there's your shamrock to go in the middle of your hat I used shamrock confetti and I used glitter glue and I just made some decorations around the brim of the Hat took my Elmer's glue and put on the confetti and glued the shamrock to the middle with a little piece of confetti now you can of course make a bowlers hat any color for any occasion but this is how I made a st. Patrick's Day bowler hat out of newspaper

title: How to Make a Paper Hat
original_title: How to Make Party Hats : How to Make a Paper Pirate Hat
content: hi this is Ginny with simply beautiful crafts on behalf of expert village and we're going to make party hats are Dan welcome to Pirates Cove mateys we're going to make a very simple pirate hat out of a newspaper you know went three sheets of newspaper you can use two but three sheets gives you a more sturdy hat that are two-sided all the way no half sheets lay it out in front of you sideways with your fold at the front and you're going to find the middle and then fold it down to the middle not quite centered up and down again leaving a little bit of space at the top so that it's even and then you're simply going to take the first three sheets one two three and fold them up and crease it [Applause] turn it over fold up the next three sheets and then fasten it I put mine on my head and then stapled it right at the sides of my head so that it would stay on my head and fit you can do that with your hat too now you have your base for your pirate hat and what I did with mine was to use black construction paper to cover the front of it but you could also use black tempera paint and I stuck it down in the Hat band and then I made a skull and crossbones and glued it on you're going to make a skull and crossbones basically you want to make kind of a light bulb shape and put the two circles for the eyes you're going to have your teeth come down again kind of to a point and have teeth and your nose make them black make your bones cut them out glue them on and voila you have a pirate's hat pretty simple huh

title: How to Make a Paper Hat
original_title: How to Make a Paper Pirate Hat | Hobbycraft
content: decorate your mash a pirate ship using acrylic paint you can have lots of fun coming up with a really piratey color scheme the next step is to fold your card in half this is going to create the larger waves to go around the outside of your hat fold it in half and then we're going to draw the wave shape along the paper this time to make the smaller waves fold your paper in half along the long side of the paper and then fold it again so you'll find this is slightly more difficult to cut through because there's four layers of card to cut through so you may have to be a bit tougher with your scissors but it's well worth it because the effect is fantastic at the end cut the leaves down the center along the fold if you have a little extra on the bottom you could always just sand that off using your glue gun run a line of glue along the bottom of your boat and then securely attaches to the Hat you'll need to hold this in place for a few minutes just so it sticks securely so it doesn't matter if it's completely straight because waves are choppy so it just adds to the sea effect next we're going to attach the waves to the Hat I'm going to use a glue gun but you could use a stapler Sini's stick lots of glue onto your waves and mold it to the shape of the Hat holding it firmly you might need to cut your waves to size so it fits around the Hat it doesn't matter if it overlaps a little bit because the other waves are going to go around the edge next we're going to attach our smaller waves around the edge of the Hat we're going to use exactly the same processes the larger waves gluing just over the top to give this layered effect you will need an adult's help with the glue gun because it does get very hot I'm going to add some treasure to my bonnet you can put it wherever you fancy so it could be around the boat or it could be at the bottom of the ocean it's completely up to you and firmly place the coins onto the Hat if you have any overlapping sections in your waves you could always put one of the coins over the top so when you stuck on your coins it obviously adds some sparkle to your hat we're going to add the bunting so you can attach this however you like you could use as little or as much as you like so I'm going to attach it the top just with a little blob of glue and you can cut off any excess just adds the finishing touches to your pirate ship

title: How to Make a Paper Hat
original_title: DIY: Paper Hat
content: [Music] hey everyone welcome back to the house station a place for on how to's and the airwaves well a must-have accessory in a girl's wardrobe is hat and especially with the summer starting in a few once a hat is a must-have and in today's video i'm going to show you how i made this hat using just paper that's it we need only paper to make this lovely hat so if you want to see how to make this then please keep watching the video to make the Hat take a balloon and blow it so that it resembles the size of your head then place it in a container and add some sellotape so that it doesn't move then take a mixture of 3/4 part of glue and 1/4 part of water and apply a layer of newspaper on half of the balloon [Music] when you're done keep this to dry let it dry completely once try apply a second layer of newspaper and then leave that to dry as well and when the second layer of newspaper dries pop the balloon so that you get this dome-like shape now take a chart paper and place the dome on it in the center and Mark points then take a plate and draw a circle connecting these points then draw a smaller circle inside the circle and then a bigger on the outside so now we have one small one medium and one big circle out of which the medium one is exactly the size of the dome now cut out the circle [Music] then from the inside circle cut slits to the middle circle now fold the paper like so [Music] so take the gnome and cut slits on that as well and fold them outwards the apply glue on these little portions and then place the chart paper on it and stick it well [Music] then apply glue on these little portions of the chart paper and stick it on the dome [Music] once that is done leave it to dry overnight so that the dome hardens then paint it with your favourite colour I chose this bright yellow color make sure to paint the side as well as even this will be showing then apply glue on the edges of the dome tie a bow on one side and that's it your hat is ready so that was my DIY paper hat I hope you all enjoyed watching the video if you did please do give the video a big fat thumbs up and share with your friends and family comment in the comments down below on how you thought the video was if there are any other how to do you have a suggestions creations goodness isn't feedbacks anything that you would like me to know please let me know that as well in the comments down below or you can hear me on Facebook and Twitter and if in case you make this hat please share pictures with me on Instagram or the links are there in the description box and most importantly please don't forget to subscribe to the how station for some more easy and inexpensive how to send DIYs on every Sunday I'll see you guys in my next video bye [Music] you [Music]

title: How to Make a Paper Hat
original_title: KIDS CRAFTS - Paper Top Hat - a HOW TO
content: in this clip I'm going to show you how to make a paper top hat you're gonna take a piece of paper a paper plate here you can take your scissors and you're going to cut out the middle by carefully poking the scissors through the top and cutting leaving a little bit of the paper plate on the top and notice that I turned the paper plate over or upside down I quickly cut that out all the way around and then I'm going to take just a regular piece of construction paper and I'm going to fold down the top just a little bit to give it some sturdy nuts because I want it to really hold together well I'm gonna put a glue stick on here pull that down and then I'm going to also fold up the bottom about a half of an inch and this is going to allow the paper top-hat to fit inside of the paper plate and I'm going to cut little slits around here which will help mold it into a circle okay the last thing I want to do is I want to overlap these so I'm going to put a little bit of glue here and I'm going to go ahead and put these two together like that and there take a piece of tape and put this right in the middle where I'm overlapping it just to support it a little bit now I'm going to put this right inside of my paper plate and I'm going to turn it upside down and I'm going to start gluing these tabs onto the paper plate just like you see here and I'm going to go ahead and show you that this last one and I want to support it again with a piece of tape and the very last thing I'm going to do is I'm going to take my magic marker and I'm going to go ahead and make that brim black and you have a great top hat

title: How to Make a Paper Hat
original_title: How to Make an Easter Bonnet Hat using paper mache
content: hi in this video I'm going to show you how you can create an imaginative Easter bonnet with your child using simple paper mache techniques first of all you need a balloon if you're making something like this out of an egg shape or if you want to make an animal or a bird you'll need a small balloon for the head and a larger balloon for the body so first of all you need to inflate the large balloon sit it in a saucepan or bowl so it sits securely while you're applying the strips of newspaper I've cut mine into 1 by 5 inch strips but you don't have to be approximate that's only approximate you don't have to do it exactly the other thing you'll need is a pot of PVA glue which has some water in so it's running and you'll need a paintbrush and your meal apron that will cover your child because it can get messy so what I recommend is that you get your child to cover an area of the balloon with glue and I'll show you that it should just run on the balloon quite easily and then when you've covered an area the balloon in PVA close then apply strips running in the same direction all around the balloon then apply another another layer of glue put on the strip's going in the opposite direction overlapping slightly so there are no gaps and then your third layer will go back to the original direction and then I recommend that for the final layer you apply some kitchen towel strips or some paper to have strips and because this provides a really good base for painting it helps it make sure that the print doesn't show through or it provides a good base if you're wanting to put squares of tissue paper onto the balloon so after about 24 hours in a really warm place your balloon will hopefully dry so that it's it's it's very solid pop the balloon and cut up a circular hole in the bottom large enough for the top of the Hat it should should fit securely on and then if you're wanting to make an Easter basket like this all you have to do is is cut a section out of each side leaving a handle shape down the middle and then your child could fill it with things that they've made here I've got homemade daffodils and decoupage eggs and some tissue paper shred or if you're interested in making one of the animals then your your need and some tissue paper shred for their for their fur or for their coat now to help you to sit the head on top of the body what I recommend is that you have used some duct tape to make some crisscross shapes at the bottom of the head and stick that on top of the body so that it's secure because what you don't want is for the kids to fall off during the Easter bonnet parade at my website wwlp.com you there were three kits available there's a chick kit there's a rabbit kit and there's a lamb kit and come with all materials that you'll need to make an Easter bonnet as well as the bonnet and a list of instructions to help you go through it step by step but if you have any questions or any ideas that you want to discuss please get in touch thank you for watching
